metadata.title: POGO & Corruption Cases Tracker - Philippines
metadata.description: Comprehensive tracking of POGO-related cases, corruption cases, and their political connections. Includes high-profile cases like Alice Guo.

cases.title: Alice Guo Identity Fraud & POGO Connections
cases.court_agency: Senate of the Philippines, NBI, PNP, Ombudsman, Anti-Money Laundering Council, BIR, Manila RTC Branch 34

pogo_connections.description: POGO operated on land owned/connected to Alice Guo
Another POGO operation in Bamban, suspected connections

charges: Violation of Anti-Trafficking in Persons Act

timeline.description: PNP (Philippine National Police) raids Hongsheng Gaming Technology Inc. in Bamban, rescues 875 individuals, many suspected victims of human trafficking
Senate Committee on Women, Children, Family Relations and Gender Equality starts probe into Alice Guo's identity and POGO connections
Questions emerge about Alice Guo's birth certificate, nationality, and identity. Allegations that she is actually Chinese national Guo Hua Ping
NBI investigation reveals discrepancies in birth certificate. Questions about late registration and authenticity
Alice Guo suspended as mayor pending investigation. Assets frozen and arrest order issued
Alice Guo flees the Philippines, traveling through Malaysia and Singapore
Office of the Ombudsman dismisses Alice Guo from mayoral position for grave misconduct related to POGO involvement. Retirement benefits forfeited, permanently barred from public office
Bureau of Internal Revenue (BIR) files criminal case against Guo for tax evasion related to transfer of shares in Baofu Land Development Inc. without filing and payment of corresponding taxes

Anti-Money Laundering Council, in collaboration with NBI and Presidential Anti-Organized Crime Commission, files multiple counts of money laundering against Guo and 35 others. Alleged to have laundered over 100 million PHP (approximately US$1.8 million) from criminal activities
Alice Guo arrested in Jakarta, Indonesia after fleeing the Philippines
Alice Guo deported back to the Philippines to face multiple charges including human trafficking, money laundering, and tax evasion. Remains in detention
Guo's arraignment for graft and corruption charges before Valenzuela court postponed due to prosecution's motion to admit amended information in criminal cases

timeline.event: Mayoral Term Declared Null and Void
timeline.description: Manila Regional Trial Court Branch 34 declares Guo's term as mayor null and void, ruling that she was a Chinese citizen and thus ineligible for the position

Philippine court convicts Alice Guo and seven co-defendants of qualified human trafficking. Sentenced to life imprisonment and fined 2 million pesos (approximately US$34,000) each. Court found that Guo oversaw an illegal online gaming complex in Tarlac province where hundreds of foreign nationals were forced to participate in cyber fraud schemes

timeline.event: Motion to Remain in Pasig Jail
timeline.description: Guo files urgent motion to remain in Pasig City Jail, delaying transfer to Correctional Institution for Women in Mandaluyong City

political_connections.description: Mayor of Bamban, issued permits for POGO operations
political_connections.details: Used position to facilitate POGO operations

political_connections.description: Family business connections to POGO operations

cases.significance: High-profile case exposing how POGO operations are facilitated by local government officials. Alice Guo was convicted of qualified human trafficking and sentenced to life imprisonment in November 2025. Her mayoral term was declared null and void after court ruled she was a Chinese citizen, not Filipino. Case demonstrates identity fraud, human trafficking, money laundering, and corruption in POGO industry.
cases.diaspora_impact: Shows how corruption enables human trafficking and illegal operations. Highlights need for transparency in local government permits and POGO regulation. The conviction demonstrates that accountability is possible, but also reveals systemic vulnerabilities that allowed a foreign national to hold public office and facilitate criminal operations.

cases.title: POGO Tax Evasion - Multiple Companies

pogo_connections.description: Systematic tax evasion by POGO operators

timeline.description: BIR files tax evasion cases against multiple POGO operators

political_connections.description: Alleged protection from tax collection, possible bribery
political_connections.details: Suspected payments to government officials to avoid tax collection

cases.significance: Major tax evasion case showing how POGO operators avoid paying taxes, depriving government of revenue.
cases.diaspora_impact: Shows how corruption and tax evasion affect government revenue, impacting public services that diaspora families rely on.

cases.title: POGO Human Trafficking - Multiple Raids

pogo_connections.description: POGO operations used as front for human trafficking

charges: Violation of Anti-Trafficking in Persons Act

timeline.description: PNP and NBI begin series of raids on POGO operations suspected of human trafficking

political_connections.description: Local officials may have issued permits or provided protection

cases.significance: Shows systematic human trafficking through POGO operations. Thousands of victims, mostly from China and other Asian countries.
cases.diaspora_impact: Highlights human rights abuses and corruption enabling trafficking. Shows need for better regulation and enforcement.

cases.title: Flood Control Projects Corruption Scandal
cases.court_agency: Senate Blue Ribbon Committee, NBI, Ombudsman, COA, Anti-Money Laundering Council

location.region: NCR, Central Luzon, Western Visayas, Multiple

accused.name: Multiple DPWH Officials
accused.position: Department of Public Works and Highways

charges: Violation of Anti-Graft and Corrupt Practices Act

timeline.description: Massive flood control projects initiated across Philippines, with billions allocated. Projects continue through 2024-2025
Commission on Audit begins investigating flood control projects, noting irregularities and potential fraud
President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. announces plans for large-scale flood control projects in State of the Nation Address
Senate Blue Ribbon Committee launches investigation into flood control project irregularities. Reports emerge of 'ghost' projects, contractor monopolies, and misallocation of funds

Explosive testimony identifies legislators and officials in flood-control corruption inquiry. Construction companies owned by Curlee and Sarah Discaya implicated in securing substantial government contracts and allegedly paying kickbacks to lawmakers

National Bureau of Investigation prepares to submit cases against DPWH officials and contractors linked to flood control scandal. Investigation reveals several firms shared directors, indicating interlocking boards

timeline.event: Senate Hearing Reveals Master Plan Absence
timeline.description: During Senate Blue Ribbon hearing, DPWH Secretary Vince Dizon admits absence of updated master plan for flood control (last plan from 2013). Senator Risa Hontiveros highlights that uncoordinated projects had worsened flooding. Contractors and former DPWH officials cited in contempt for providing false information

Mass protests erupt across Philippines demanding accountability for misuse of flood control funds. Citizens call for radical changes and resignation of President Marcos Jr. Demonstrators highlight systemic corruption affecting infrastructure projects
House Speaker Martin Romualdez and Senate President Francis Escudero resign amid flood control corruption scandal
Philippines unveils new jail facility for legislators who may face corruption trial. Facility prepared to house high-profile politicians implicated in flood control scandal

President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. announces that numerous high-profile politicians, including senators and members of Congress, will be jailed by Christmas for involvement in corruption scandal. Charges include graft, corruption, and plunder. Assets worth billions of pesos frozen
Anti-Money Laundering Council freezes assets worth 6.3 billion pesos, including over 1,600 bank accounts and luxury vehicles linked to flood control corruption
Commission on Audit initiates performance audit of government flood control projects. Fraud audit ordered for Bulacan projects covering January 2022 to July 2025

political_connections.description: House Speaker and Senate President implicated in approving and overseeing flawed flood control projects
political_connections.details: Martin Romualdez (House Speaker) and Francis Escudero (Senate President) resigned in September 2025 amid scandal

political_connections.description: DPWH officials allegedly colluded with contractors in project bidding and execution
political_connections.details: Multiple DPWH officials under investigation for mismanaging and misallocating funds

political_connections.description: Small group of contractors cornered contracts worth around 20% of administration's flood control expenditures. Interlocking boards suggest collusion
political_connections.details: Discaya-owned construction companies secured substantial contracts in Bulacan and Iloilo City

political_connections.description: Contractors allegedly paid kickbacks to lawmakers and officials for project approvals
political_connections.details: Testimony revealed systematic kickback scheme involving legislators and contractors

dynasty_connections.connection: Alleged approval and oversight of corrupt flood control projects
Alleged approval and oversight of corrupt flood control projects

cases.significance: Massive corruption scandal involving approximately â‚±118.5 billion ($2 billion) misused in over 9,800 flood control projects since 2023. Led to resignation of House Speaker and Senate President. Reveals systemic corruption in infrastructure projects, with 'ghost' projects, contractor monopolies, and substandard work. Public outrage led to mass protests demanding accountability.
cases.diaspora_impact: Shows how corruption in infrastructure projects directly impacts Filipino communities through substandard flood control leading to devastating floods. Billions of pesos meant for public safety were misappropriated, affecting millions of Filipinos. Highlights need for transparency and accountability in public infrastructure spending.
